channel.title: CVE Feed for Query Solutions -- Redirection for Contact Form 7
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Query Solutions -- Redirection for Contact Form 7

item.title: CVE-2021-24278|2024-08-03T19:28:23.300Z -- query%20solutions -- redirection%20for%20contact%20form%207
item.description: In the Redirection for Contact Form 7 WordPress plugin before 2.3.4, unauthenticated users can use the wpcf7r_get_nonce AJAX action to retrieve a valid nonce for any WordPress action/function.

item.title: CVE-2021-24281|2024-08-03T19:28:22.730Z -- query%20solutions -- redirection%20for%20contact%20form%207
item.description: In the Redirection for Contact Form 7 WordPress plugin before 2.3.4, any authenticated user, such as a subscriber, could use the delete_action_post AJAX action to delete any post on a target site.

item.title: CVE-2021-24280|2024-08-03T19:28:23.438Z -- query%20solutions -- redirection%20for%20contact%20form%207
item.description: In the Redirection for Contact Form 7 WordPress plugin before 2.3.4, any authenticated user, such as a subscriber, could use the import_from_debug AJAX action to inject PHP objects.

item.title: CVE-2021-24279|2024-08-03T19:28:22.645Z -- query%20solutions -- redirection%20for%20contact%20form%207
item.description: In the Redirection for Contact Form 7 WordPress plugin before 2.3.4, low level users, such as subscribers, could use the import_from_debug AJAX action to install any plugin from the WordPress repository.

item.title: CVE-2021-24282|2024-08-03T19:28:22.813Z -- query%20solutions -- redirection%20for%20contact%20form%207
item.description: In the Redirection for Contact Form 7 WordPress plugin before 2.3.4, any authenticated user, such as a subscriber, could use the various AJAX actions in the plugin to do a variety of things. For example, an attacker could use wpcf7r_reset_settings to reset the pluginâ€™s settings, wpcf7r_add_action to add actions to a form, and more.
